This Foucault Pendulum in the main lobby of the UN Headquarters in New York offers visual proof of the earth's rotation.

The 200-pound gold-plated sphere is suspended from the ceiling 75 feet above the floor and over a raised metal ring, containing an electromagnet in the centre. The sphere is held by a stainless steel wire which allows the weighted ball to swing freely in any plane. It slowly shifts in a clockwise direction, with a complete cycle taking about 36 hours and 45 minutes.

A gift to the UN from the Government of the Netherlands, the pendulum utilizes the principle first demonstrated by the noted French physicist, J. Foucault.

The Wititi dance of the Colca Valley, #Peru.

The Wititi dance is a folk dance associated with the beginning of adult life. Typically performed by young people at religious festivities during the rainy season, it features couples in traditional costume dancing in rows to music by a band.
Coinciding with the start of the agricultural cycle, the dance symbolizes renewal of nature and society. Competitions between villages renew the practice while strengthening social ties and cultural identity. The tradition is passed down at school and in family gatherings. #IntangibleHeritage

The practice is one of the new elements inscribed by #UNESCO to the list of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 2015.

This Foucault Pendulum in the main lobby of the UN Headquarters in New York offers visual proof of the earth's rotation.

The 200-pound gold-plated sphere is suspended from the ceiling 75 feet above the floor and over a raised metal ring, containing an electromagnet in the centre. The sphere is held by a stainless steel wire which allows the weighted ball to swing freely in any plane. It slowly shifts in a clockwise direction, with a complete cycle taking about 36 hours and 45 minutes.

A gift to the UN from the Government of the Netherlands, the pendulum utilizes the principle first demonstrated by the noted French physicist, J. Foucault.

How do people catch Zika?
People catch Zika virus by being bitten by the same type of infected mosquito that spreads dengue, chikungunya and yellow fever.

What are the symptoms?
Most people with Zika virus disease will get a slight fever and rash. Others may also get conjunctivitis, muscle and joint pain, and feel tired. 

How is it treated?
The symptoms of Zika virus disease can be treated with common pain and fever medicines, rest and plenty of water. If symptoms worsen, people should seek medical advice. There is currently no cure or vaccine for the disease itself.
